Title: How surveillance companies track smartphone users through advertising data
Subhead: Companies are offering law enforcement agencies the ability to track smartphone users through advertising data gathered on their devices. Le Monde attended confidential presentations of these new surveillance tools to learn more.

Title: Trump cancels tariff threat over Greenland, says NATO agreed to 'framework' of future Arctic deal
European Parliament throws EU-Mercosur agreement into uncertainty
US House panel begins push to hold Clintons in contempt over Epstein probe
Subhead: The full House of Representatives, also majority Republican, will now decide whether to formally cite the couple for contempt and refer them to the Justice Department for possible criminal prosecution, at a date yet to be announced.

Title: Infant formula sector rocked by massive recalls of Lactalis and Nestlé products contaminated by the same toxin
Subhead: Global dairy giants have been forced to recall infant formula on a large scale after detecting cereulide, a toxin produced by bacteria. France's agriculture ministry confirmed that a single supplier in China produced the raw material responsible.

Title: Paris men's fashion week: From the runway to live performance
Subhead: Etudes Studio, Jeanne Friot, and Lemair: three labels choose cultural venues to bring a theatrical dimension to their collections.

Title: Cohere's Joëlle Pineau: 'We aim for AI that creates value for businesses, not superintelligence'
Subhead: The former number two in artificial intelligence research at Meta left Mark Zuckerberg's group to join the Canadian start-up.

Title: Maya Kandel, historian: 'The more Trump uses force, the more confident he becomes'
Venezuelan interim president Rodriguez to visit United States

'French military involvement in Greenland is not for show'

French gender equality council warns of threat posed by masculinist networks
Syria's government gives Kurds more time to reach an agreement
Claude Le Roy: 'The Senegalese players were overwhelmed by emotion and completely lost control'
Lactalis recalls baby formula in several countries over toxin
Davos takes stock of a transatlantic alliance trampled by Trump
'The Wizard of the Kremlin': An epic tale of power through the eyes of a man in the shadows
Trump's desire to avoid military force over Greenland a 'positive' sign, Denmark says
In the Ukrainian Carpathians, peace feels both near and far
Subhead: In Uzhhorod, a border city near Slovakia, exhausted and disillusioned residents have long stopped believing in victory and expect little from ongoing diplomatic talks. They only hope that the war will end, even 'if it means sacrificing a piece of the country to be saved.'

Title: In one year, Trump has imposed a culture of impunity
Subhead: Since returning to the White House, the American president has exempted himself from all rules, both domestically and internationally. This sense of impunity now permeates his entire administration.

Title: Bastien François, political scientist: 'There are good and bad ways to use Article 49.3' of the French Constitution
Subhead: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu's decision to ram the budget through Parliament without a vote, using Article 49.3 of the Constitution, is not undemocratic, explains political science professor Bastien François.

Title: A 'Board of Peace,' to do what?
The necessary showdown with Donald Trump
Golshifteh Farahani, Iranian actress: 'Resisting horror, dictatorships and invaders is in our blood'
